headline: Will Elon Musk‚Äôs America Party facilitate green Bitcoin?
summary: On July 7, 2025, on X, Elon Musk claimed that his recently announced political party will embrace Bitcoin, stating that ‚Äúfiat is hopeless.‚Äù In the past, Musk had conflicting relations with Bitcoin. In 2021, his company, Tesla, halted support of Bitcoin payments, citing Bitcoin‚Äôs environmental impact. What is Musk‚Äôs current political platform, and what‚Äôs his stance on Bitcoin‚Äôs environmental impact? The America Party After a very public disagreement with U.S. President Donald Trump over government spending, Elon Musk took to X on July 4 to state that Independence Day is the perfect time to ask people if they want independence from a two-party system and attached the poll: ‚ÄúShould we create the America Party?‚Äù There were only two options, yes and no. In 24 hours, over 1.2 million votes were cast, with ‚Äúyes‚Äù beating ‚Äúno‚Äù at a 2:1 ratio. Then, Musk claimed that the focus on several seats in the Senate and several House districts would be enough to have political influence. Several hours later, he declared that the party was formed ‚Äúto give you back your freedom.‚Äù By a factor of 2 to 1, you want a new political party and you shall have it! When it comes to bankrupting our country with waste & graft, we live in a one-party system, not a democracy. Today, the America Party is formed to give you back your freedom. https://t.co/9K8AD04QQN ‚Äî Elon Musk (@elonmusk) July 5, 2025 Many Republicans expressed displeasure, noting that ‚Äúthe third party‚Äù would only split the Republican vote and let Democrats win instead of fixing the country. Some suggested that the third party already exists, and it‚Äôs called MAGA. Others offered Musk to join the Libertarian Party instead, as it already has some achievements and it‚Äôs better not to begin from scratch. I am staying as a Republican. We are 74,606 *active* voters away from flipping Pennsylvania üü¶üîúüü•. If you do NOT like Governor Shapiro or that democrats shut down Pennsylvania during COVID, a third party will only help re-elect Shapiro in 2026. ‚Äî ThePersistence (@ScottPresler) July 5, 2025 On July 5, 2025, Musk launched another poll, asking if we need a party that represents the 80% in the middle. 80% of voters chose the ‚Äúyes‚Äù answer. Is it time to create a new political party in America that actually represents the 80% in the middle? ‚Äî Elon Musk (@elonmusk) June 5, 2025 While Musk is yet to release the party‚Äôs platform, he replied ‚Äúyeah‚Äù to several points offered by tech investor Tyler Palmer. In his view, the America Party should reduce debt and fight for responsible spending, modernize the military with AI robotics, boost technologies and AI, reduce regulation (especially in the energy sector), and be pronatalist and pro-free speech. As Musk greeted this post, it was copied many times by other accounts, publishing it as the America Party platform. Is this the America Party platform? -reduce debt, responsible spending only -modernize military with ai/robotics -pro tech, accelerate to win in ai -less regulation across board but especially in energy -free speech -pro natalist -centrist policies everywhere else If so‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Tyler Palmer (@tyler__palmer) July 5, 2025 On July 7, 2025, an X user, Renato Lima, asked Musk if the America Party is going to embrace Bitcoin. Musk replied , ‚ÄúFiat is hopeless, so yes.‚Äù Someone has already created a ‚Äúnot affiliated‚Äù account of the America Party on X. In several days, it got over 300,000 subscribers, including notable Bitcoin influencers. The account posts Musk‚Äôs statements and silently promotes a memecoin via a link in the bio. Musk‚Äôs environmental concerns and Bitcoin A huge part of Musk‚Äôs success is intertwined with his push for eco-friendly technology. It has been impacting his businesses, his political activity, and his relationships with cryptocurrencies. Musk‚Äôs dedication and leadership in producing electric vehicles are based on his concern about climate change and CO2 emissions. Prioritizing solar power over fossil fuels is another element of Musk‚Äôs strive to rebuild the industries so that emissions will be reduced. Notably, after Trump‚Äôs victory in the 2024 election, Musk backed Trump‚Äôs crackdown on electric vehicles. He supported Trump‚Äôs aim to take away subsidies for those buying electric cars. According to Musk, it would hurt General Motors and Ford before Tesla. Take away the subsidies. It will only help Tesla. Also, remove subsidies from all industries! ‚Äî Elon Musk (@elonmusk) July 16, 2024 As Tesla‚Äôs sales tanked this year, Musk criticized taking away subsidies on eco-friendly vehicles. While some claim that Musk was advocating for the subsidies‚Äô removal in the past, he rather wanted to lift them from other oil/fossil-based industries too, so generally Musk never stepped away from his ecology focus. However, Musk‚Äôs recent ‚Äúyeah‚Äù reply to the platform containing the ‚Äúless regulation in energy‚Äù clause may look like a step back in terms of striving for the war on CO2 emissions. There is no change to tax incentives for oil & gas, just EV/solar https://t.co/kJFMfLOGV0 ‚Äî Elon Musk (@elonmusk) May 29, 2025 In 2021, Musk made waves in the crypto market by publishing tweets about Dogecoin and Bitcoin. At some point, Tesla Motors started to accept Bitcoin as a payment for its vehicles. However, soon the company reconsidered its decision, citing Bitcoin‚Äôs environmental impact. As the Bitcoin network consumes as much energy as entire countries, Musk decided to look for greener options. Read more: Bitcoin harmful to the environment, or not? Opinions vary, truth is singular Despite Musk‚Äôs change of heart on Bitcoin, Tesla remained one of the top corporate holders of Bitcoin with 11,509 coins on its balance sheet, according to Bitbo. Bitcoin enthusiasts have found many ways to mine Bitcoin with excessive energy, effectively reducing harmful emissions rather than impacting the environment. So, it is not impossible for Elon Musk to be involved in Bitcoin without compromising his ‚Äúgreen‚Äù reputation. Musk‚Äôs political ambitions After several months of service as the head of the Department of Government Efficiency, Musk had to step down in May as his work was limited to a 130-day appointment. The department was set to cut government spending. He was usually seen with Trump and was present at high-profile meetings. This fact allegedly was annoying many people outside and inside Trump‚Äôs circle. In June, Musk began to criticize the project of the ‚ÄúOne big, beautiful bill.‚Äù He cited the potential of increasing the U.S. national debt by a whopping $5 trillion in ten years, scrapping the achievements of Musk‚Äôs activity in the government in cutting spending. He said that he would start a new political party if the bill were adopted, which he did. However, in July, his main obsession on X is the Epstein list. Musk is posting memes about it, asking why the case is not investigated properly, and replying to Epstein-themed posts of other users. On June 5, 2025, he mentioned that Trump is on the Epstein list. Ever since, Musk has been trying to use it as a tool in the conflict with the POTUS. ü§¨ pic.twitter.com/Oe9jPGoQRR ‚Äî Elon Musk (@elonmusk) July 7, 2025 Yet, it‚Äôs not clear how serious Musk is when it comes to creating the America Party and what impact it can have. However, despite Musk‚Äôs advocacy for EV subsidies removal in the past, it doesn‚Äôt seem that the America Party can ignore ecological concerns. Speaking of Bitcoin, it is possible that Musk would popularize the eco-friendly ways of mining BTC the way he popularized electric vehicles. headline: Truth Social‚Äôs Groundbreaking Crypto ETF: A New Era for Digital Asset Investment
summary: BitcoinWorld Truth Social‚Äôs Groundbreaking Crypto ETF: A New Era for Digital Asset Investment The financial world is abuzz with a surprising development: Truth Social , the social media platform founded by former U.S. President Donald Trump, has reportedly filed for a groundbreaking Crypto ETF with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This isn‚Äôt just any ETF; it‚Äôs a ‚Äúblue-chip‚Äù offering poised to include heavyweights like Bitcoin , Ethereum , Solana, XRP, and Cronos. This bold move could signal a significant shift in how mainstream investors access digital assets, blending the realms of social media, politics, and the burgeoning cryptocurrency market. What is a Crypto Blue-Chip ETF and Why Does it Matter? An Exchange Traded Fund (ETF) is an investment vehicle that holds assets like stocks, bonds, or commodities, and trades on stock exchanges. A Crypto ETF , specifically, holds cryptocurrencies or derivatives tied to their prices. The term ‚Äúblue-chip‚Äù in this context refers to established, highly reputable, and financially sound cryptocurrencies that are generally considered safer and more stable investments within the volatile crypto market. Think of them as the equivalent of Coca-Cola or Apple in the stock market. The significance of a blue-chip Crypto ETF , especially one proposed by a high-profile entity like Truth Social , cannot be overstated. It offers several compelling advantages for investors: Accessibility: Investors can gain exposure to cryptocurrencies without the complexities of direct ownership, such as setting up digital wallets, managing private keys, or dealing with various exchanges. Diversification: A single ETF can provide diversified exposure to multiple top cryptocurrencies, reducing the risk associated with investing in just one digital asset. Regulation: Trading through a regulated ETF offers a layer of investor protection that direct crypto investments often lack. Liquidity: ETFs trade on traditional stock exchanges, offering high liquidity and ease of buying and selling throughout the trading day. For many traditional investors, this type of ETF could be the bridge they need to enter the digital asset space with greater confidence and less friction. Truth Social‚Äôs Ambitious Foray into Digital Assets Truth Social , primarily known as a social media platform, venturing into the financial services sector with a Crypto ETF is an intriguing development. While the exact motivations are multifaceted, they likely include: Diversification of Revenue Streams: Expanding beyond advertising and subscription models into the lucrative asset management space. Catering to a Tech-Savvy User Base: Many users of alternative social media platforms are often early adopters of new technologies, including cryptocurrencies. Leveraging Brand Recognition: The association with a prominent political figure can draw significant attention and potential investment, even from those who might otherwise be hesitant about crypto. Strategic Positioning: Positioning itself at the forefront of the convergence between digital finance and mainstream investment. This move highlights a growing trend where companies from diverse sectors are exploring opportunities within the blockchain and cryptocurrency ecosystem, recognizing the immense potential of digital assets to reshape finance. The Blue-Chip Lineup: Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Beyond The proposed ETF‚Äôs inclusion of specific cryptocurrencies ‚Äî Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Solana (SOL), XRP, and Cronos (CRO) ‚Äî provides a snapshot of what‚Äôs considered the cream of the crop in the crypto world. Let‚Äôs briefly explore why each of these assets holds a ‚Äúblue-chip‚Äù status: Bitcoin (BTC): The Digital Gold Standard Bitcoin , the world‚Äôs first and largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, is often referred to as ‚Äúdigital gold.‚Äù It serves primarily as a store of value and a medium of exchange, decentralized and resistant to censorship. Its limited supply and established network effect make it a foundational asset in any diversified crypto portfolio. For many, Bitcoin represents the entry point into the world of digital finance. Ethereum (ETH): The Backbone of Decentralized Applications Ethereum is the second-largest cryptocurrency and is much more than just a digital currency. It‚Äôs a decentralized platform that enables smart contracts and decentralized applications (dApps) to be built and run without any downtime, fraud, control, or interference from a third party. It powers the vast ecosystems of Decentralized Finance (DeFi), Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), and countless other blockchain innovations. Its upgrade to Ethereum 2.0 (now called the Consensus Layer) and its move to a Proof-of-Stake consensus mechanism further enhance its scalability and energy efficiency, cementing its status as a vital blue-chip asset. Solana (SOL): The High-Performance Challenger Solana has rapidly risen to prominence due to its high throughput and low transaction costs, making it a formidable competitor to Ethereum for dApp development. Its innovative proof-of-history consensus mechanism allows it to process thousands of transactions per second, attracting developers and users looking for speed and efficiency. XRP: Bridging Traditional Finance and Blockchain XRP is the native cryptocurrency of the XRP Ledger, an open-source, permissionless, and decentralized blockchain technology. Developed by Ripple Labs, XRP is designed for fast, low-cost international payments and remittances, aiming to facilitate cross-border transactions for financial institutions. Despite ongoing regulatory challenges, its utility in real-world payment solutions gives it a unique position. Cronos (CRO): Powering a Crypto Ecosystem Cronos is the native cryptocurrency of the Cronos Chain, an EVM-compatible blockchain developed by Crypto.com. CRO is integral to the Crypto.com ecosystem, enabling users to pay fees, earn rewards, and participate in governance across various Crypto.com products, including its exchange, DeFi wallet, and NFT marketplace. Its utility within a rapidly expanding crypto services platform gives it blue-chip potential. Here‚Äôs a quick comparison of these blue-chip assets: Cryptocurrency Primary Use Case Key Feature Bitcoin (BTC) Store of Value, Digital Gold First & Largest Crypto, Decentralized Ethereum (ETH) Smart Contracts, dApps, DeFi Programmable Blockchain, Large Ecosystem Solana (SOL) High-Performance dApps Fast Transactions, Low Fees XRP Cross-Border Payments Institutional Focus, Efficient Transfers Cronos (CRO) Ecosystem Utility (Crypto.com) EVM-Compatible Chain, Rewards The Critical Role of the SEC Filing and Regulatory Hurdles The most crucial step for this Crypto ETF to become a reality is the approval by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The SEC filing process is rigorous and designed to protect investors by ensuring transparency and compliance with securities laws. The SEC has historically been cautious about approving spot crypto ETFs, citing concerns about market manipulation, custody, and investor protection in an unregulated market. However, the landscape has been shifting. The approval of several Bitcoin spot ETFs earlier this year marked a significant turning point, demonstrating a growing regulatory comfort with certain digital asset products. While a Bitcoin ETF was a major hurdle, an ETF encompassing multiple cryptocurrencies, including altcoins like Solana and Cronos, presents new challenges for the SEC. Each asset needs to be thoroughly vetted for market integrity, liquidity, and potential risks. The SEC filing for a multi-asset crypto ETF by Truth Social will undoubtedly attract intense scrutiny, both from regulators and the broader financial community. The outcome of this filing will set a precedent for future multi-asset crypto investment products and could influence the regulatory trajectory for digital assets in the United States. Potential Impact and Benefits for the Crypto Market Should Truth Social ‚Äôs Crypto ETF receive approval, its impact on the digital asset market could be profound: Increased Institutional Adoption: An approved ETF provides a familiar and regulated pathway for institutional investors, pension funds, and wealth managers to allocate capital to cryptocurrencies, potentially bringing in billions of dollars. Enhanced Market Legitimacy: SEC approval would lend significant credibility to the included cryptocurrencies and the broader digital asset space, signaling that these assets are maturing and gaining acceptance within traditional finance. Broader Retail Investor Access: Millions of everyday investors who are comfortable with traditional brokerage accounts but hesitant about direct crypto purchases could easily gain exposure. Price Stability and Liquidity: Increased inflows from institutional and retail investors could lead to greater market depth, potentially reducing volatility and improving liquidity for the underlying assets. Innovation and Competition: The success of such an ETF could spur other financial institutions to launch similar products, fostering innovation and competition in the crypto investment landscape. Challenges and Considerations Ahead While the prospects are exciting, several challenges and considerations remain: Regulatory Hurdles: As mentioned, the SEC filing process is arduous. The SEC will scrutinize market surveillance, custody solutions, and potential conflicts of interest, especially given the political ties of Truth Social . Market Volatility: Despite their ‚Äúblue-chip‚Äù status, cryptocurrencies are inherently volatile. An ETF would still be subject to significant price swings, which might not be suitable for all investors. Custody and Security: Ensuring the secure custody of the underlying digital assets for an ETF of this scale is a complex logistical and security challenge. Political Scrutiny: Given Truth Social ‚Äòs founder, the ETF proposal could face additional political and public scrutiny, potentially influencing the regulatory timeline and outcome. Fees and Performance: The success of the ETF will also depend on its fee structure and its ability to accurately track the performance of its underlying assets. Actionable Insights for Investors For investors watching this space, here are some actionable insights: Stay Informed: Keep a close eye on the SEC filing progress and any announcements from Truth Social or the SEC regarding this ETF. Regulatory updates will be key. Understand the Underlying Assets: Even if you plan to invest via an ETF, take the time to understand the fundamentals of Bitcoin , Ethereum , and the other included cryptocurrencies. Assess Your Risk Tolerance: Remember that even a blue-chip crypto ETF carries inherent risks due to the volatility of the underlying assets. Ensure it aligns with your investment goals and risk profile. Diversify Wisely: While the ETF offers internal diversification, consider how it fits into your broader investment portfolio. A New Horizon for Digital Asset Investment? The Truth Social Crypto ETF filing represents a significant moment in the ongoing convergence of traditional finance and the digital asset economy. It signifies not just a growing acceptance of cryptocurrencies but also an innovative approach by a social media company to diversify and expand its footprint. While the path to approval through the SEC filing process is fraught with challenges, the potential for this blue-chip ETF to open new avenues for investment in Bitcoin , Ethereum , and other leading digital assets is undeniable. It could truly usher in a new era of mainstream accessibility and institutional engagement, redefining how we perceive and interact with the future of finance. headline: Metaplanet Sets Bold Plan to Buy Digital Bank With Bitcoin
summary: Metaplanet, a company listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange, is taking a new and bold approach to business growth using Bitcoin (BTC). The company, which holds a significant amount of the top cryptocurrency, aims to utilize its substantial crypto holdings to finance the acquisition of profitable businesses. Metaplanet‚Äôs CEO, Simon Gerovich, recently shared that the company plans to buy a digital bank in Japan. This represents a significant shift from its original business direction as a hotel operator. Metaplanet Started Buying Bitcoin to Grow in the Future In 2024, Metaplanet began buying Bitcoin to hedge against inflation . Since then, it has continued to add to its reserve. By early July 2025, the company owned 15,555‚ÄØBTC after spending $239 million to buy 2,205 more coins. With this, the Japanese-based firm is now the fifth-largest public company in the world, holding the flagship crypto. On average, it has paid about $99,985 for each coin. The company‚Äôs long-term goal is to own over 210,000‚ÄØBTC by 2027. This would be around 1% of all the Bitcoin that will ever exist. Metaplanet‚Äôs leadership sees this aggressive accumulation as a critical first phase. The goal is to achieve a level of Bitcoin ownership that places the company significantly ahead of any potential competitors. Bitcoin as a Tool for Business Expansion In the next phase of its plan, Metaplanet intends to use its Bitcoin holdings as collateral. This would enable the company to access loans and raise funds, much like businesses use stocks or government bonds. These funds would then be used to acquire companies that generate steady income. One of the main targets under consideration is a digital bank. The company believes it can offer better services than regular banks by entering the digital finance space. This plan is part of Metaplanet‚Äôs goal to mix digital assets with modern financial services. To help grow the business, Metaplanet may issue preferred shares instead of taking on regular debt. This choice helps the company avoid repaying loans under strict rules or adjusting share prices. With this method, Metaplanet aims to attract long-term investors without the stress of short-term repayments. Metaplanet Sees Strong Growth Even with Small Revenue Metaplanet is not generating significant revenue yet, but its stock has increased by over 345% this year, pushing its market value above $7 billion. This considerable jump indicates that many investors are confident in Metaplanet‚Äôs strategy to focus on Bitcoin. This sharp rise in stock value is similar to what has happened with Strategy, a U.S. company that owns the most Bitcoin among all public companies. Strategy‚Äôs Bitcoin-focused strategy has helped it reach a market value of more than $112 billion. Metaplanet is following a similar path in Asia. headline: Bitcoin Futures: CME Dominance Signals Monumental Institutional Shift
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Futures: CME Dominance Signals Monumental Institutional Shift Are you ready to witness a monumental shift in the cryptocurrency landscape? The latest data reveals a compelling story about who is truly driving the Bitcoin market now. For years, retail traders dominated the narrative, but a significant change is underway, signaling a maturing market where big players are taking the lead. The Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) has now firmly positioned itself at the forefront of Bitcoin futures open interest, a clear indicator of burgeoning institutional demand. Understanding the Rise of Bitcoin Futures and Open Interest Before we dive into the specifics of CME‚Äôs ascent, let‚Äôs clarify what Bitcoin futures and open interest mean. Bitcoin futures are financial contracts that obligate the buyer or seller to transact Bitcoin at a predetermined future date and price. They allow investors to speculate on Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements without actually owning the underlying asset. Open interest, on the other hand, represents the total number of outstanding derivative contracts that have not been settled. It‚Äôs a crucial metric because it reflects the total amount of money flowing into the futures market, indicating liquidity and market depth. A rising open interest suggests new money entering the market, while a falling open interest indicates money leaving. The significance of open interest, particularly in the context of Bitcoin, lies in its ability to gauge market sentiment and participation. High open interest often correlates with strong market conviction and can precede significant price movements. When institutional players engage, their capital infusion adds substantial depth and stability, fundamentally altering the market‚Äôs dynamics. CME Open Interest Takes the Lead: A Detailed Look According to the CoinGlass H1 2025 report, as of June 1, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) has officially surpassed all other platforms in Bitcoin futures open interest. This isn‚Äôt just a marginal lead; it‚Äôs a decisive statement from the traditional finance world. Wu Blockchain on X highlighted that CME recorded a staggering 158,300 BTC in open interest, significantly outpacing Binance, which stood at 118,700 BTC. Key Takeaways from the Data: CME‚Äôs Dominance: The 158,300 BTC figure for CME represents a robust vote of confidence from institutional investors who prefer regulated, traditional venues for their crypto exposure. Binance‚Äôs Market Share Decline: While still a major player, Binance‚Äôs second position indicates a shift in the landscape, with its market share in Bitcoin futures open interest diminishing relative to CME. This could be attributed to increased regulatory scrutiny on offshore exchanges and institutions favoring regulated alternatives. Widening Gap: The report also points to a widening gap between Binance and other prominent exchanges like OKX and Bybit. This suggests a consolidation of institutional activity on platforms like CME, while the broader market for retail and some institutional players remains distributed but with a clear leader emerging. This shift isn‚Äôt merely about numbers; it reflects a deeper trend in the crypto market . Institutions, with their massive capital, are increasingly comfortable entering the digital asset space, but they demand the infrastructure and regulatory clarity that traditional exchanges like CME provide. This preference is reshaping how Bitcoin is traded and perceived globally. What Drives This Surging Institutional Demand ? The rise of institutional demand for Bitcoin futures on CME is not accidental. Several factors contribute to this significant trend: 1. Regulatory Clarity and Compliance: CME is a regulated derivatives exchange based in the United States. For large financial institutions, regulatory compliance is paramount. Trading on a regulated platform minimizes legal and operational risks, providing a sense of security that is often lacking on less regulated crypto-native exchanges. This clarity is a major draw for hedge funds, asset managers, and corporate treasuries. 2. Familiarity and Infrastructure: Traditional finance players are accustomed to the trading mechanisms and infrastructure offered by exchanges like CME. The systems, settlement processes, and risk management tools are familiar, making the transition into Bitcoin futures smoother than navigating the often-complex and varied interfaces of pure crypto exchanges. 3. Liquidity and Depth: As more institutions enter, they bring significant capital, enhancing liquidity on CME. High liquidity ensures that large orders can be executed with minimal price impact, a critical factor for institutional-sized trades. This creates a virtuous cycle: more liquidity attracts more institutions, further deepening the market. 4. Macroeconomic Factors and Diversification: In an environment of economic uncertainty and inflation concerns, Bitcoin is increasingly viewed as a potential hedge or a store of value. Institutions are diversifying their portfolios to include digital assets, and futures contracts offer a convenient, non-custodial way to gain exposure without directly holding Bitcoin, which can have its own set of operational challenges. Implications for the Broader Digital Assets Ecosystem CME‚Äôs dominance in Bitcoin futures open interest has profound implications for the entire digital assets ecosystem: Market Maturation: The increased participation of institutional investors signals a maturing market. It suggests that Bitcoin is moving beyond its speculative, retail-driven origins and is becoming a recognized asset class within traditional finance. This legitimacy can attract even more mainstream adoption. Price Discovery and Stability: Institutional capital tends to bring more stability and efficiency to price discovery. Their long-term investment horizons and sophisticated trading strategies can reduce volatility compared to purely retail-driven markets. While volatility will always be a characteristic of crypto, institutional involvement can temper extreme swings. Future Product Development: The success of Bitcoin futures on CME could pave the way for more sophisticated institutional products, such as Bitcoin spot ETFs (Exchange-Traded Funds), options, and other structured products. This expansion of investment vehicles will further integrate crypto into traditional financial markets. Competitive Landscape Shift: Crypto-native exchanges will need to adapt. While they may continue to cater to retail and certain institutional segments, the trend towards regulated venues for large-scale derivatives trading is undeniable. This could spur more crypto exchanges to seek regulatory licenses and enhance their compliance frameworks. Challenges and Considerations While the rise of institutional demand is largely positive, it‚Äôs essential to consider potential challenges: Centralization Concerns: As more volume flows through regulated, centralized entities like CME, some in the crypto community might raise concerns about the decentralization ethos of Bitcoin. Increased Correlation with Traditional Markets: Greater institutional involvement could lead to Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements becoming more correlated with traditional financial assets, potentially reducing its appeal as an uncorrelated hedge. Regulatory Scrutiny: With increased institutional adoption comes increased regulatory attention. While beneficial for legitimacy, it could also lead to more stringent rules and oversight for the entire crypto industry. Actionable Insights for Investors For both retail and institutional investors, this shift offers several actionable insights: Monitor Institutional Flows: Keep an eye on open interest data from CME and other regulated exchanges. Rising open interest can be a bullish signal, indicating strong institutional conviction. Understand Market Structure: Recognize that the market is evolving. headline: UK small-cap firms are adopting MicroStrategy‚Äôs Bitcoin treasury model
summary: Several UK-listed small-cap companies are now copying a controversial American playbook that turned a tech firm into a full-on Bitcoin proxy. The plan is simple but aggressive: issue new shares, raise cash, and buy Bitcoin. Executives hope this move will push their stock prices higher by giving investors indirect exposure to crypto, something that‚Äôs still difficult to access in the UK. This development was brought to our attention by Axel Cabrol, Co-Deputy CIO at TOBAM, whose research paper Accounting for the Performance of MicroStrategy shows that British firms are now trying to do what MicroStrategy did in the US between 2020 and 2024, when it massively outperformed Bitcoin itself using a Bitcoin treasury strategy. Axel believes that while this model isn‚Äôt without risk, it could be one of the few tools available to revive UK equities. He also made it clear that just because a company adds Bitcoin to its balance sheet doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôll succeed. ‚ÄúBitcoin adoption is no magic wand that turns lead into gold,‚Äù said Axel, warning that companies must know what they‚Äôre doing and whether the strategy fits their business. MicroStrategy outperforms Bitcoin using a three-pronged structure Between 2021 and 2024, MicroStrategy‚Äôs stock jumped 7.5x, while Bitcoin rose just 3.2x. According to TOBAM, the outperformance came from three things: turning the stock‚Äôs premium into book value and buying more Bitcoin with it, increasing exposure to Bitcoin over time through that same mechanism, and taking advantage of spikes in the premium at which its stock traded compared to the value of its Bitcoin holdings. TOBAM‚Äôs study, conducted by Axel along with Yves Choueifaty and Tristan Froidure, says the strategy works best when the company can issue new shares at a premium, then use that money to buy more Bitcoin, generating something they call a ‚ÄúBitcoin Yield.‚Äù When the company sells shares at inflated prices and turns that cash into more Bitcoin, it boosts its exposure and stock performance. In 2021 and 2024, MicroStrategy managed to generate a Bitcoin Yield of around 50%. But of course, the strategy isn‚Äôt perfect. In 2023, even though the company added 43% more Bitcoin to its holdings, it had to increase its number of shares by 48%. That meant the Bitcoin Yield turned negative and dragged on the stock‚Äôs performance. Bitcoin Price Premium gives investors more than coin performance The paper explains that performance also depends on how far the company‚Äôs shares trade above the value of the Bitcoin it holds. This is called the Bitcoin Price Premium, and it fluctuates based on demand. MicroStrategy‚Äôs returns were boosted when this premium grew. If the premium had stayed flat in 2021, shareholders would have nearly doubled Bitcoin returns anyway. But because the premium expanded in 2023 and 2024, investors got more‚Äîup to three times Bitcoin‚Äôs performance in some periods. Exposure also played a role. The company‚Äôs realized exposure to Bitcoin (Œ≤) was sometimes higher than one. In 2022, during a crypto sell-off, the firm‚Äôs stock traded at a discount to its Bitcoin, which pushed its exposure above normal. In 2024, the company started with a relatively low beginning-of-year exposure (Œ≤‚ÇÄ = 0.75), but the massive 61% Bitcoin Yield that year pushed realized exposure to 1.2. Source: Axel Cabrol, Yves Choueifaty, and Tristan Froidure In simple terms, MicroStrategy found ways to give shareholders more upside than Bitcoin itself. This is exactly what UK firms want. But the model only works if the company knows how to manage dilution, time the issuance of shares, and buy Bitcoin strategically. If they screw up the balance, the strategy can collapse fast. Axel said the recent moves by UK small caps to mimic this structure could finally give British retail and wealth investors a practical way into crypto markets. ‚ÄúThis will also allow UK wealth and retail investors to gain exposure to cryptocurrency where it has previously been more challenging,‚Äù he said. With the UK far behind the US in regulated crypto investment options, this indirect route might be the only access some investors have for now. But TOBAM‚Äôs research ends on a warning. Axel, Yves, and Tristan made it clear that this model is not a guaranteed fix. Execution is everything. If done wrong, the company ends up with diluted equity and poor returns. If done right, it could be the last card these firms play to stay listed and to finally get some attention from markets that have mostly forgotten them. summary: Murano Global Investments, a Nasdaq-listed real estate developer and hotel owner, launched a record $500 million Bitcoin treasury program, among the largest non-tech corporate crypto moves to date. MicroStrategy, Semler, and the New Corporate BTC Wave MicroStrategy was the initial corporate Bitcoin trailblazer to utilize bonds and share issues to accumulate the world's largest corporate BTC holding. Their procedure relied on elevated leverage and prominent chief executive officer, so Bitcoin featured centrally in their brand message and investor narrative. Semler's move, in contrast with MicroStrategy's tech roots, meant the move into Bitcoin was spreading beyond software and finance. The company's move to buy a significant portion of its balance sheet in BTC demonstrated that even traditionally fiscally conservative sectors could value digital assets as both a hedge and a growth opportunity. Murano is venturing into new territory as the first big real estate developer to use property equity and sale-leasebacks to fund a BTC war-chest. This strategy is new: rather than tapping pure debt or cash reserves, Murano is literally converting illiquid real estate worth into liquid holdings of Bitcoin. In the process, the company is hedging not just against currency risk and inflation but sending a message that the next leg of corporate adoption of Bitcoin is extending into traditional sectors like real estate and hospitality. Murano's action can set the stage for a broader set of industries to consider digital assets as a strategic balance sheet asset, taking the corporate BTC wave much further than its origins in the tech industry.

Zachary Witkoff, son of Trump associate Steve Witkoff, formalized partnerships to embed blockchain technology into Pakistan‚Äôs financial systems. The IMF noted Pakistan failed to consult the agency ahead of the 2,000MW allocation announcement, seeking urgent clarification from the Finance Ministry. Pakistan faces chronic energy shortages and inflationary pressures, with the IMF warning about potential knock-on effects on power tariffs. Officials involved in negotiations expressed concerns about ‚Äú further tough talks ‚Äù as the economic team faces tough questions over the initiative. Despite IMF resistance, Pakistan continues to pursue its crypto ambitions through diplomatic channels. U.S. President Trump expressed keen interest in cryptocurrency during a White House lunch with Pakistan Army Chief Field Marshal Asim Munir, discussing economic development and emerging technologies. PVARA will oversee public protection mechanisms, anti-money laundering protocols, and cyber risk mitigation across all virtual asset transactions.
